title: JSON schema for VTEX IO Store Framework

flex-layout.row.title: Flex Layout (Row)
flex-layout.row.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-flex-layout

Layout structure built within VTEX IO store framework. It allows the construction of complex custom layouts using the concept of rows and columns, setting the desired structure and positioning of blocks in a given page.

`"vtex.flex-layout@0.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

children.markdownDescription: Declare the blocks that must be wrapped inside the current one.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

borderWidth.markdownDescription:
`0...5`

A `number` or `string` magnitude for the `bw` Tachyons token to be applied to the row.

border.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

An array to define in which sides of the row a border should be applied to (`top`, `right`, `bottom`, `left` or `all`).

colGap.markdownDescription:
`0...10`

A `number` or `string` magnitude for the pr Tachyons token to be applied to columns inside of the `flex-layout.row`.

colSizing.markdownDescription:
`equal | auto`

Controls the width of the columns inside the `flex-layout.row`.

fullWidth.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Whether or not the component should occupy all the available width from its parent.

horizontalAlign.markdownDescription:
`left | right | center`

Controls horizontal alignment for the items inside the `flex-layout.row`.

marginBottom.markdownDescription:
`0...10`

A `number` or `string` magnitude for the `mb` Tachyons token to be applied to the row.

marginTop.markdownDescription:
`0...10`

A `number` or `string` magnitude for the `mt` Tachyons token to be applied to the row.

paddingBottom.markdownDescription:
`0...10`

A `number` or `string` magnitude for the `pb` Tachyons token to be applied to the row.

paddingTop.markdownDescription:
`0...10`

A `number` or `string` magnitude for the `pt` Tachyons token to be applied to the row.

preserveLayoutOnMobile.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Whether or not the `flex-layout.row` should break into a column layout on mobile.

preventHorizontalStretch.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Prevents the row from stretching horizontally to fill its parent width.

preventVerticalStretch.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Prevents the row from stretching vertically to fill its parent height with `items-stretch` token.

rowGap.markdownDescription:
`0...10`

A `number` or `string` magnitude for the `pb` Tachyons token to be applied to columns inside of the `flex-layout.row`.

colJustify.markdownDescription:
`string`

Apply some of the `justify-content` values [NO DOCS].

flex-layout.col.title: Flex Layout (Column)
flex-layout.col.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-flex-layout

Layout structure built within VTEX IO store framework. It allows the construction of complex custom layouts using the concept of rows and columns, setting the desired structure and positioning of blocks in a given page.

`"vtex.flex-layout@0.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

children.markdownDescription: Declare the blocks that must be wrapped inside the current one.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

borderWidth.markdownDescription:
`0...5`

A `number` or `string` magnitude for the `bw` Tachyons token to be applied to the column.

border.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

An array to define in which sides of the column a border should be applied to (`top`, `right`, `bottom`, `left` or `all`).

horizontalAlign.markdownDescription:
`left | right | center`

Controls horizontal alignment for the items inside the `flex-layout.col.`

marginLeft.markdownDescription:
`0...10`

A `number` or `string` magnitude for the `ml` Tachyons token to be applied to the column.

marginRight.markdownDescription:
`0...10`

A `number` or `string` magnitude for the `mr` Tachyons token to be applied to the column.

paddingLeft.markdownDescription:
`0...10`

A `number` or `string` magnitude for the `pl` Tachyons token to be applied to the column.

paddingRight.markdownDescription:
`0...10`

A `number` or `string` magnitude for the `pr` Tachyons token to be applied to the column.

preventVerticalStretch.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Prevents the row from stretching vertically to fill its parent height with `height: 100%`, using `height: auto` instead.

rowGap.markdownDescription:
`0...10`

A `number` or `string` magnitude for the `pb` Tachyons token to be applied to rows inside of the `flex-layout.col.`

verticalAlign.markdownDescription:
`top | middle | bottom`

Controls vertical alignment for the items inside the `flex-layout.col.`

width.markdownDescription:
`0...100% | grow`

Sets the width of the column. Accepts either a percentage or 'grow'.

add-to-cart-button.title: Add To Cart Button
add-to-cart-button.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-add-to-cart-button

The add-to-cart-button is a block responsible for adding products in the Minicart (minicart.v2).

`"vtex.add-to-cart-button@0.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

onClickBehavior.markdownDescription:
enum

Controls what happens when users click on the button. Possible values are: `go-to-product-page`, `add-to-cart`, and `ensure-sku-selection` (if multiple SKUs are available, users will be redirected to the product page to select the desired one. If the product only has 1 SKU available, it will be added to the cart once the button is clicked on).

onClickEventPropagation.markdownDescription:
enum

Controls whether the 'onClick' event (triggered upon user clicks) should be spread to the page's parent elements. Possible values are: disabled and enabled.

isOneClickBuy.markdownDescription:
boolean

Whether the user should be redirected to the checkout page (true) or not (false) when the Add To Cart Button is clicked on.

customOneClickBuyLink.markdownDescription:
string

Defines the link to where users will be redirected when the Add To Cart Button is clicked on and the isOneClickBuy prop is set to true.

customToastUrl.markdownDescription:
string

Defines the link to where users will be redirected when the Toast (pop-up notification displayed when adding an item to the minicart) is clicked on.

text.markdownDescription:
string

Defines a custom text message to be displayed on the Add To Cart Button.

unavailableText.markdownDescription:
string

Defines a custom text message to be displayed on the Add To Cart Button when a product is unavailable.

customPixelEventId.markdownDescription:
string

Define the id for the event that will be sent by the the button upon user interaction.

breadcrumb.markdownDescription:

The VTEX BreadCrumb is a navigation scheme that shows a user's browsing history up to their current location in your store.

It determines whether Breadcrumb should also be displayed on mobile

homeIconSize.markdownDescription:
number

Controls the size property of IconHome

caretIconSize.markdownDescription:
number

Controls the size property of IconCaret

rich-text.title: Rich Text
rich-text.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-rich-text

The Rich Text is a block that brings texts to your store and everything else that Markdown language is able to. It converts texts written in Markdown language and displays its content as HTML elements.

`"vtex.rich-text@0.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

font.markdownDescription:
string | {desktop: string, tablet: string, mobile: string}

Define the tachyon token to be used as font. Default: t-body

textColor.markdownDescription:
string

Define the tachyon token to be used as text color. Default: c-on-base

text.markdownDescription:
TextAlignmentEnum

Text written in markdown language to be displayed.

Markdown Cheatsheet: https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/wiki/Markdown-Cheatsheet

textAlignment.markdownDescription:
TextAlignmentEnum

Control the text alignment inside component. Default: 'LEFT'

oneOf.markdownDescription: Text will be to the left. If isFullModeStyle is false, image will be on the right
Text will be in the center. Not applicable if isFullModeStyle is false.
Text will be to the right. If isFullModeStyle is false, image will be on the left

textPosition.markdownDescription:
TextPositionEnum

Choose in which position of the component text will be displayed, left, center or right. Default: 'LEFT'

oneOf.markdownDescription: Text alignment will be to the left.
Text alignment will be to the center.
Text alignment will be to the right.

htmlId.markdownDescription:
string

Add an `id` HTML attribute to this rich-text element [NO DOCS]

disclosure-layout.title: Disclosure Layout
disclosure-layout.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-disclosure-layout

![Mandatory](https://img.shields.io/badge/-Mandatory-red.png) Parent block that enables you to build the disclosure layout using its 3 children blocks: `disclosure-trigger`, `disclosure-content`, and `disclosure-state-indicator`.

`"vtex.disclosure-layout@1.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

children.markdownDescription: Declare the blocks that must be wrapped inside the current one.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

initialVisibility.markdownDescription:
enum

Defines the initial visibility of the layout content. Possible values are: `visible` (content initially open) or `hidden` (content is only displayed with user interaction).

animated.markdownDescription:
boolean

Whether or not the layout content should have animations. When set as true, this prop will enable additional data-* attributes on the content which you can use as selectors in CSS. It will also ensure that the element will get hidden once the transition has ended.

disclosure-trigger.title: Disclosure Layout (Trigger)
disclosure-trigger.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-disclosure-layout

Declares the blocks that will be rendered as disclosure triggers i.e. the blocks that when clicked on will open or close the disclosure content (defined by the disclosure-content block).

`"vtex.disclosure-layout@1.x"`

children.markdownDescription: Name of the block that will be rendered in case no blocks are declared in the Show or Hide props.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

Show.markdownDescription:
block

Name of the block that will be rendered when prompt to show the content.

Hide.markdownDescription:
block

Name of the block that will be rendered when prompt to hide the content.

as.markdownDescription:
string

HTML tag to be applied to the component when it is rendered on the UI.

disclosure-content.title: Disclosure Layout (Content)
disclosure-content.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-disclosure-layout

Declares the blocks that are responsible for displaying the desired content when the disclosure trigger is clicked on.

`"vtex.disclosure-layout@1.x"`

children.markdownDescription: List of blocks that will render the desired disclosure content.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

disclosure-state-indicator.title: Disclosure Layout (State Indicator)
disclosure-state-indicator.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-disclosure-layout

Optional block responsible for rendering chevron or other UI elements that change when the disclosure is opened or closed.

`"vtex.disclosure-layout@1.x"`

children.markdownDescription: List of blocks that will render the desired disclosure content.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

Show.markdownDescription:
block

Name of the block that will be rendered when prompt to show the content.

Hide.markdownDescription:
block

Name of the block that will be rendered when prompt to hide the content.

disclosure-layout-group.title: Disclosure Layout (Group)
disclosure-layout-group.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-disclosure-layout

Wraps many disclosure-layouts blocks at once. You may use this block to control when each one of them should be displayed, making it possible to have only one disclosure-layout open at a time.

`"vtex.disclosure-layout@1.x"`

children.markdownDescription: List of blocks that will render the desired disclosure content.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

maxVisible.markdownDescription:
enum

Defines how many disclosure-layout blocks should be displayed at time. Possible values are: one (only one disclosure-layout block should have its content displayed at time) or many (different disclosure-layout's contents can be displayed at time).

disclosure-trigger-group.title: Disclosure Layout (Trigger Group)
disclosure-trigger-group.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-disclosure-layout

Wraps many disclosure-trigger blocks at once. You may use this block to control when and how the disclosure-layouts blocks declared inside the disclosure-layout-group should be displayed.

`"vtex.disclosure-layout@1.x"`

children.markdownDescription: List of blocks that will render the desired disclosure content.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

Show.markdownDescription:
block

Name of the block that will be rendered when prompt to show the content.

Hide.markdownDescription:
block

Name of the block that will be rendered when prompt to hide the content.

as.markdownDescription:
block

HTML tag to be applied to the component when it is rendered on the UI.

condition-layout.product.title: Condition Layout (Product)
condition-layout.product.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-condition-layout

Defines the condition logic on the product context and the children blocks that are going to be rendered in case the predefined conditions are met.

`"vtex.condition-layout@2.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

subject.markdownDescription:
string

Defines, according to the product context where the block in declared in, which data is needed from the UI to validate the value chosen in the object prop. Check below the possible values for this prop.

**Subject** | **Arguments**

productId | `{ id: string }`

categoryId | `{ id: string }`

brandId | `{ id: string }`

selectedItemId | `{ id: string }`

productClusters | `{ id: string }`

categoryTree | `{ id: string }`

specificationProperties | `{ name: string, value: string? }`

areAllVariationsSelected | *No arguments are expected.*

isProductAvailable | *No arguments are expected.*

hasMoreSellersThan | `{ quantity: number }`

arguments.markdownDescription:
object

Defines the condition parameters. Notice: this prop value varies according to the value set to the subject prop. Check below the table for the subject's possible values and their expected arguments.

**Subject** | **Arguments**

productId | `{ id: string }`

categoryId | `{ id: string }`

brandId | `{ id: string }`

selectedItemId | `{ id: string }`

productClusters | `{ id: string }`

categoryTree | `{ id: string }`

specificationProperties | `{ name: string, value: string? }`

areAllVariationsSelected | *No arguments are expected.*

isProductAvailable | *No arguments are expected.*

hasMoreSellersThan | `{ quantity: number }`

toBe.markdownDescription:
boolean

Whether the data fetched in the subject prop must met the predefined conditions to render the new layout (true) or not (false).

matchType.markdownDescription:
enum

Layout rendering criteria. Possible values are: all (all conditions must be matched in order to render the layout), any (at least one of the conditions must be matched in order to render the layout) or none (no conditions must be matched in order to render the layout).

Then.markdownDescription:
block

Name of the block to be rendered if the conditions are met. If no value is defined, the blocks declared as children of condition-layout.product will be rendered instead.

Else.markdownDescription:
block

Name of the block to be rendered if the conditions are not met.

Defines the condition logic on the current binding and the children blocks that are going to be rendered in case the predefined conditions are met.

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

**Subject** | **Arguments**

arguments.markdownDescription:
object

DDefines, according to the product context where the block in declared in, which data is needed from the UI to validate the value chosen in the object prop. Check below the possible values for this prop.

**Subject** | **Arguments**

bindingId | `{ id: string }`

toBe.markdownDescription:
boolean

Whether the data fetched in the subject prop must met the predefined conditions to render the new layout (true) or not (false).

matchType.markdownDescription:
enum

Layout rendering criteria. Possible values are: all (all conditions must be matched in order to render the layout), any (at least one of the conditions must be matched in order to render the layout) or none (no conditions must be matched in order to render the layout).

Then.markdownDescription:
block

Name of the block to be rendered if the conditions are met. If no value is defined, the blocks declared as children of condition-layout.product will be rendered instead.

Else.markdownDescription:

Name of the block to be rendered if the conditions are not met.

boolean

Whether a tooltip responsible for checking the password format should be shown (true) or not (false).

showIconProfile.markdownDescription:
boolean

Whether the `hpa-profile` icon from [Store Icons](https://vtex.io/docs/components/all/vtex.store-icons/) should be displayed on the Login component (`true`) or not (`false`).

iconLabel.markdownDescription:
string

Text string to entitle the Login icon.

hideIconLabel.markdownDescription:
boolean

Whether the text string defined for the Login icon should be hidden (true) or not (false).

providerPasswordButtonLabel.markdownDescription:
string

Text to be displayed as the password button label.

hasIdentifierExtension.markdownDescription:
boolean

Whether the identifier extension configurations should be enabled (`true`) or not (`false`). For more info on this, check out the [Advanced Configurations](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-login#advanced-configuration)

identifierPlaceholder.markdownDescription:
string

Text to be displayed as placeholder to the extension input.

invalidIdentifierError.markdownDescription:
string
