mirrorTooltipToRight.markdownDescription:
boolean

Whether the Login tooltip should open towards the right side of the screen (true) or not (false).

logInButtonBehavior.markdownDescription:
enum

Expected behavior of the Login component when clicked on. Possible values are: popover (opens a popover tab) and link (redirects user to the /login page).

accountOptionsButtonBehavior.markdownDescription:
enum

Expected behavior of the My account button when clicked on. Possible values are: popover (opens a popover tab) and link (redirects user to the /account page).

accountOptionLinks.markdownDescription:
[object]

Creates a custom link to replace the default one set for the accountOptionsButtonBehavior's link value (/account). Check out below the available props for the object.

label.markdownDescription:
string

Text label for the custom link.

termsAndConditions.markdownDescription:
string

Text to be displayed below the login options regarding terms&conditions.

hasGoogleOneTap.markdownDescription:
boolean

[BETA] Whether the [Google's One-tap sign-up and auto sign-in](https://developers.google.com/identity/one-tap/web/) solution should be enabled (true) or not (false).

googleOneTapAlignment.markdownDescription:
enum

[BETA] Defines pop-up alignment for the Google One-tap login. Possible values are Left and Right.

googleOneTapMarginTop.markdownDescription:
string

[BETA] Defines the pop-up top margin for the Google One-tap login. The values supported are the same supported by the CSS property top.

disabledEmailInputs.markdownDescription:
boolean

Whether user email editing should be allowed (true) or not (false).

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

isInitialScreenOptionOnly.markdownDescription:
boolean

Whether only the login options will be displayed on the initial screen (true) or not (false).

defaultOption.markdownDescription:
enum

Defines the default login options to be shown. Possible values are: 0 (shows the access-code option for login) and 1 (shows the email/password option for login).

optionsTitle.markdownDescription:
string

Defines the default login options to be shown. Possible values are: 0 (shows the access-code option for login) and 1 (shows the email/password option for login).

emailPlaceholder.markdownDescription:
string

Text to be displayed as placeholder to the email input.

passwordPlaceholder.markdownDescription:
string

Text to be displayed as placeholder to the password input.

accessCodePlaceholder.markdownDescription:
string

Text to be displayed as placeholder to the access code input.

showPasswordVerificationIntoTooltip.markdownDescription:
boolean

Whether a tooltip responsible for checking the password format should be shown (true) or not (false).

providerPasswordButtonLabel.markdownDescription:
string

Text to be displayed as the password button label.

hasIdentifierExtension.markdownDescription:
boolean

Whether the identifier extension configurations should be enabled (`true`) or not (`false`). For more info on this, check out the [Advanced Configurations](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-login#advanced-configuration)

identifierPlaceholder.markdownDescription:
string

Text to be displayed as placeholder to the extension input.

invalidIdentifierError.markdownDescription:
string

Error message for invalid user identifier.

termsAndConditions.markdownDescription:
string

Text to be displayed below the login options regarding terms&conditions.

disabledEmailInputs.markdownDescription:
boolean

Whether user email editing should be allowed (true) or not (false).

minicart.v2.title: Minicart
minicart.v2.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-minicart

The VTEX Minicart is a block that displays a summary list of all items added by customers in their shopping cart. Its data is fetched from the Checkout OrderForm API.

![Warning](https://developers.vtex.com/img/emojis/warning.png|width=12px) The Minicart v2 will only effectively function if the store uses the Add To Cart Button instead of the Buy Button in blocks such as the Shelf and the Product Details Page.

`"vtex.minicart@2.x"`

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

variation.markdownDescription:
enum

Minicart behavior when rendered. Possible values are: popup (it pops up on the Homepage in a minitab window) , drawer (it is rendered through a side bar) or link (when clicked on, it redirects the user to the Checkout page).

drawerSlideDirection.markdownDescription:
enum

Slide direction for the drawer Minicart opening. Possible values are: rightToLeft or leftToRight).

linkVariationUrl.markdownDescription:
string

Link associated to the link Minicart.

maxDrawerWidth.markdownDescription:
number

Maximum width (in pixels) for the drawer Minicart when opened.

openOnHover.markdownDescription:
boolean

Whether the popup minicart should open when the user hovers over it.

quantityDisplay.markdownDescription:
enum

Shows the quantity badge even when the amount of products in the cart is zero. Possible values are: always or not-empty or never.

itemCountMode.markdownDescription:
enum

Quantity badge behavior when displaying the number of total items added in Minicart. Possible values are: total, distinct, totalAvailable and distinctAvailable.

oneOf.markdownDescription: Quantity badge displays the number of items added to the cart
Only displays the number of different products added to the cart
Displays the number of available items added to the cart
Displays the number of different and available products added to the cart

backdropMode.markdownDescription:
enum

Controls whether the backdrop should be displayed when the drawer Minicart is opened or not. Possible values are: visible (rendering the backdrop) or none (rendering the drawer without backdrop).

MinicartIcon.markdownDescription:
block

Icon displayed in the Minicart button. This prop's value must match the name of the block responsible for rendering the desired icon.

customPixelEventId.markdownDescription:
string

Store event ID responsible for triggering the minicart.v2 to automatically open itself on the interface.

customPixelEventName.markdownDescription:
string

Store event name responsible for triggering the minicart.v2 to automatically open itself on the interface. Some examples are: 'addToCart' and 'removeFromCart'. Notice that using this prop will make the minicart.v2 open in every event with the specified name if no customPixelEventId is specified.

logo.title: Logo
logo.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-store-components-logo

Logo is a VTEX block responsible for displaying an image logo for the store header.

`"vtex.store-components@3.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

title.markdownDescription:
string!

The image alt description

vtex.menu@2.x:menu.title: Menu
vtex.menu@2.x:menu.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-menu

VTEX Menu is a store component responsible for displaying a bar containing links and drop-down sub-menus.

To build the store's menu options, you need to configure the `menu-item` blocks. These can be declared in two different ways in `vtex.menu@2.x:menu`: as `children` or as `props`. The advantage of this latest menu-item configuration compared is that Site Editor can be used to edit the blocks.

`"vtex.menu@2.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

children.markdownDescription: Declare the blocks that must be wrapped inside the current one.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

blocks.markdownDescription: Declare the blocks that must be wrapped inside the current one.

menu-item:props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

type.markdownDescription:
string

Menu item type, either category or custom

highlight.markdownDescription:
boolean

Whether the item has highlight

iconPosition.markdownDescription:
string

Icon position relative to the menu item text. Either to the left or right

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

type.markdownDescription:
string

Menu item type, either internal or external

noFollow.markdownDescription:
string

Icon classname when isActive is true

tagTitle.markdownDescription:
string

Icon classname when isActive is false

product-assembly-options.title: Product Customizer
product-assembly-options.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-product-customizer

The Product Customizer allows a product's [attachments](https://help.vtex.com/tutorial/o-que-e-um-anexo--aGICk0RVbqKg6GYmQcWUm) and/or its subscription to be made available and ready to be defined by users on the product details page.

![Mandatory](https://img.shields.io/badge/-Mandatory-red.png) Top level block responsible for displaying the product customizer default component, showing product's attachments. Use this block's children list to define which attachment data you want to display for users.

`"vtex.product-customizer@2.x"`

children.markdownDescription: Declare the blocks that must be wrapped inside the current one.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

initiallyOpened.markdownDescription:
`enum`

By default, the customization box is opened if the attachment is required and closed if it's not. You can override this behavior by setting this prop to `always`, making it be opened even if the attachment is not required. Leave it as `required` for the default behavior.

assembly-option-input-values.title: Product Customizer (Assembly Option Input Values)
assembly-option-input-values.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-product-customizer

![Mandatory](https://img.shields.io/badge/-Mandatory-red.png) Displays a checkbox or a dropdown list field so users can choose the desired attachment for their products.

`"vtex.product-customizer@2.x"`

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

optionsDisplay.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Define whether the attachment's pre-defined options will be displayed to be selected in a Checkbox (`box`) or in a dropdown list (`select`).

assembly-option-item-customize.title: Product Customizer (Assembly Option Item Customize)
assembly-option-item-customize.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-product-customizer

Renders a button `Customize` that when clicked on opens a modal to customize the attachment.

`"vtex.product-customizer@2.x"`

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

buttonProps.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Defines how the `Customize` button will behave. In addition to the `collapse` prop, the `buttonProps` object also receives child blocks to build the content of the modal triggered when the button is clicked on.

collapse.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Customize button positioning. Possible values are: `left` or `right`.

children.markdownDescription: Child blocks to build the content of the modal triggered when the button is clicked on.

product-list.title: Product List
product-list.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-product-list

The Product List component displays all items in the user's cart and informs the user when some of them are unavailable.

![Warning](https://developers.vtex.com/img/emojis/warning.png|width=12px) Currently, the Product List only works with the Minicart v2.

![Mandatory](https://img.shields.io/badge/-Mandatory-red.png) Top level block that must be declared in the `minicart-product-list` block to render a default detailed list with all products added to the shopping cart.

`"vtex.product-list@0.x"`

blocks.markdownDescription: Declare the blocks that must be wrapped inside the current one.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

itemCountMode.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Quantity badge behavior when displaying the number of total items added in Minicart

oneOf.markdownDescription: Displays the number of items added to the cart
Only displays the number of different products added to the cart
Displays the number of available items added to the cart
Only displays the number of different and available products added to the cart

itemCountMode.markdownDescription:
`number`

The height (px) of each item's loading element.

`number`

The distance (px) to the bottom of the viewport that each item should be at the moment of it's render.

product-list-content-desktop.title: Product List (Desktop Layout)
product-list-content-desktop.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-product-list

Creates the product list layout for desktop devices.

`"vtex.product-list@0.x"`

children.markdownDescription: Declare the blocks that must be wrapped inside the current one.

product-list-content-mobile.title: Product List (Mobile Layout)
product-list-content-mobile.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-product-list

Creates the product list layout for mobile devices.

`"vtex.product-list@0.x"`

children.markdownDescription: Declare the blocks that must be wrapped inside the current one.

message.title: Product List (Message)
message.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-product-list

Renders a message text about the product availability.

`"vtex.product-list@0.x"`

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

layout.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Availability message position on the list.

oneOf.markdownDescription: Displaying the message in the product row
Displaying in the product column

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

textAlign.markdownDescription:
`string`

Product price position on the list.

showListPrice.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Whether the product prices should be displayed on the list (`true`) or not (`false`).

unit-price.title: Product List (Unit Price)
unit-price.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-product-list

Renders the price for each product unit added to the cart.

`"vtex.product-list@0.x"`

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

textAlign.markdownDescription:
`string`

Product price position on the list.

unitPriceType.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Defines whether the price type should be displayed. Possible values are: `sellingPrice` or `price`

unitPriceDisplay.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Defines when the unit price should be displayed.

oneOf.markdownDescription: Unit price is always displayed
Unit price is only displayed when the number of products is greater than one

displayUnitListPrice.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Defines whether the product list price should be displayed or not.

oneOf.markdownDescription: List price is displayed when it is different from the regular price
list price is never displayed

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.
All available properties for this block.

identifierLabel.markdownDescription:
`number`

Text label to be displayed to the left of the product reference value.

identifierOption.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Desired product reference data i.e. product identifier to be displayed. Possible options are: `ProductId`, `ProductSkuItemId`, `ProductReferenceId`, and `ProductSkuReferenceId`.

remove-button.title: Product List (Remove Button)
remove-button.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-product-list

Renders a button that allows users to remove a product from the list.

`"vtex.product-list@0.x"`

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

variation.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Variation for the button visual prominence based on the [VTEX Styleguide](https://styleguide.vtex.com/#/Components/Forms/Button). Possible values are: `primary`, `secondary`, `tertiary`, `inverted-tertiary`, `danger` and `danger-tertiary`.

displayMode.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Defines how the remove button should be displayed. If you desire to [create a modal in the remove button](https://vtex.io/docs/recipes/templates/creating-modals-using-icons/), use the `icon-button` value.

oneOf.markdownDescription: To render an icon button
To render a text message button

quantity-selector.title: Product List (Quantity Selector)
quantity-selector.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-product-list

Renders a selector that allows users to add a chosen number of a product in their cart.

`"vtex.product-list@0.x"`

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

mode.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Mode of the quantity selector input.

oneOf.markdownDescription: On the default mode, the quantity stepper will initially render a dropdown component, and after the quantity exceeds 10, it will switch to an input.
In the stepper mode it will always render a numeric stepper component.

quantitySelectorStep.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Defines how the number of products that have `unitMultiplier` will works.

oneOf.markdownDescription: The quantity will be not affected with the `unitMultiplier`
The quantity will be affected with the `unitMultiplier`

search-bar.title: Search Bar
search-bar.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-store-components-searchbar

Search Bar is a VTEX Component that shows a search bar with autocomplete options and displays the matching products as well. This component can be imported and used by any VTEX App.

`"vtex.store-components@3.x"`

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

attemptPageTypeSearch.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

If `true` when clicked on result link of brand, department or category will link to the corresponding brand, department or category page. When `false` will always go to a full text search page.

autocompleteFullWidth.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

If `true`, the autocomplete will fill the whole window horizontally.

autoFocus.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Define if the search input should autofocus or not

blurOnSubmit.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Define if input should blur on submit.

compactMode.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Define when to use the compact version of the component

customSearchPageUrl.markdownDescription:
`string`

Template for a custom url. It can have a substring `${term}` used as placeholder to interpolate the searched term. (e.g. `/search?query=${term}`)

displayMode.markdownDescription:
`DisplayMode`

Define the component display mode, such as which buttons should be visible.

oneOf.markdownDescription:
Empty state:

![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12702016/74764904-5cc5e580-5261-11ea-9df8-484cf457c266.png|height=22px)

Filled state:

![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12702016/74764917-60f20300-5261-11ea-8911-11c8fd9582d9.png|height=22px)

Empty state:

![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12702016/74764924-62bbc680-5261-11ea-9f1d-2118274da996.png|height=22px)

Filled state:

![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12702016/74764928-64858a00-5261-11ea-9ed2-42da887e6641.png|height=22px)

Empty state:

![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12702016/74764929-65b6b700-5261-11ea-815c-ecc9f0c44e0f.png|height=22px)

Filled state:

![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12702016/74764934-66e7e400-5261-11ea-8a86-59da9a1c0faa.png|height=22px)

emptyPlaceholder.markdownDescription:
`string!`

Shows a placeholder when the ResultList hasn't results to displayed

hasIconLeft.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Define if the search icon is on left or right position

maxWidth.markdownDescription:
`number | string`

Max width of the search bar. If value is a`string`, it must be succeeded by `px`, `em`, `%` etc.

minSearchTermLength.markdownDescription:
`number`

If defined, it will block searches where the term length is lesser than `minSearchTermLength`.

openAutocompleteOnFocus.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Define if autocomplete should be open on input focus or not.

placeholder.markdownDescription:
`string!`

Placeholder to be used on the input

inputType.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Defines the value for the `type` HTML attribute (from the `<input>` field). Possible values are: `search` and `text`. We strongly recommend you to use `search` as it fixes some iOS issues. The `text` value is only kept as default for backwards compatibility.

containerMode.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Defines how the autocomplete component should be displayed

oneOf.markdownDescription: Suggestions overlapping other components
Displays the suggestion within a container

disableBlurAndTouchEndHandler.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

The autocomplete can have touchable/clickable components. Interacting with those components may trigger blur and touch events that will close the autocomplete. When set to true, this prop will disable those handlers.

back-to-top-button.title: Back To Top Button
back-to-top-button.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-store-components-backtotopbutton

`back-to-top-button` is a store block exported by the Store Components app that redirects users to the top of the page when clicked on.

`"vtex.store-components@3.x"`

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

displayThreshold.markdownDescription:
`number`

Defines the window Y pixel in which the button will be displayed.

oneOf.markdownDescription: Displays a button with a `Back To Top` label text
Displays just an icon.

image.title: Image
image.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-store-components-image

The `Image` is a VTEX block that allows to add any image in the store. It can also be used as `image-new`, from `Store Image` app.

`"vtex.store-components@3.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

image-new.title: Image (from Store Image)
image-new.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-store-image

The `Image` is a VTEX block that allows to add any image in the store.

`"vtex.store-image@0.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

image:props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

src.markdownDescription:
`string!`

Specifies the URL of an image

alt.markdownDescription:
`string`

Specifies an alternate text for an image

width.markdownDescription:
`number | string`

Specifies the width of an image. If value is a`string`, it must be succeeded by `px`, `em`, `%` etc.

height.markdownDescription:
`number | string`

Specifies the height of an image. If value is a`string`, it must be succeeded by `px`, `em`, `%` etc.

maxWidth.markdownDescription:
`number | string`

Specifies the max width of an image. If value is a`string`, it must be succeeded by `px`, `em`, `%` etc.

maxHeight.markdownDescription:
`number | string`

Specifies the max height of an image. If value is a`string`, it must be succeeded by `px`, `em`, `%` etc.

minWidth.markdownDescription:
`number | string`

Specifies the min width of an image. If value is a`string`, it must be succeeded by `px`, `em`, `%` etc.

minHeight.markdownDescription:
`number | string`

Specifies the min height of an image. If value is a`string`, it must be succeeded by `px`, `em`, `%` etc.

srcset.markdownDescription:
`string`

Specifies the URL of the image to use in different situations. [(Example on how to use srcset and sizes attributes)](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLImageElement/sizes#html)

sizes.markdownDescription:
`string`

Specifies image sizes for different page layouts. [(Example on how to use srcset and sizes attributes)](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLImageElement/sizes#html)

title.markdownDescription:
`string`

Title to be shown on hover

link.markdownDescription:
`object`

Specifies the link the image will redirect when clicked on

url.markdownDescription:
`string`

URL users will be redirected to when clicking on the image.

openNewTab.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Whether a new tab on browser will be opened (`true`) or not (`false`).

attributeNofollow.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Specifies the link the image will redirect when clicked on

info-card.title: Info Card
info-card.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-store-components-infocard

The `infoCard` block allows you to display content combining image and text in your store.

`"vtex.store-components@3.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

isFullModeStyle.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

If true, image provided will be used as a background image and text will be displayed over it.

textPosition.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Choose in which position of the component text will be displayed, left, center or right.

oneOf.markdownDescription: Text will be to the left. If `isFullModeStyle` is false, image will be on the right
Text will be in the center. Not applicable if `isFullModeStyle` is false.
Text will be to the right. If `isFullModeStyle` is false, image will be on the left

textAlignment.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Control the text alignment inside component. This prop is ignored if isFullModeStyle is true.

oneOf.markdownDescription: Text alignment will be to the left.
Text alignment will be to the center.
Text alignment will be to the right.

headline.markdownDescription:
`string`

Text to be used as headline. If not provided, it will not be rendered.

subhead.markdownDescription:
`string`

Text to be displayed underneath the headline. If not provided, it will not be rendered.

textMode.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Chooses which text mode should be used to process the text from `headline` and `subhead` props.

oneOf.markdownDescription: The InfoCard component will expect to receive HTML text for `headline` and `subhead` props.
The InfoCard component will expect to receive Markdown text for `headline` and `subhead` props, and will use the [rich-text block](https://github.com/vtex-apps/rich-text) to render both.

callToActionMode.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Set Call to Action component mode.

oneOf.markdownDescription:
`string`

Don't render any Call to Action component

`string`

Call to Action component will be a button

`string`

Call to Action component will be a text in a link format

callToActionText.markdownDescription:
`string`

Text to be displayed inside the CTA component.

callToActionUrl.markdownDescription:
`string`

URL to be redirected when CTA component is clicked.

callToActionLinkTarget.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Where to display the linked URL when CTA component is clicked. These values are the same ones supported by HTML5 anchor tags. For more information check its documentation at [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a).

oneOf.markdownDescription: Open the link in the current browsing context.
Open the link in a new tab, but users can configure browsers to open a new window instead.
Open the link in the parent browsing context of the current one. If no parent, behaves as `_self`.
Open the link in the topmost browsing context (the 'highest' context that’s an ancestor of the current one). If no ancestors, behaves as `_self`.

imageUrl.markdownDescription:
`string`

URL of the image to be used on desktop.

mobileImageUrl.markdownDescription:
`string`

URL of the image to be used on mobile. If you do not provide any, the desktop image url will be used.

htmlId.markdownDescription:
`string`

Adds an ID to the container element.

linkTarget.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Where to display the linked URL when info-card block is clicked. These values are the same ones supported by HTML5 anchor tags. For more information check its documentation at [MDN](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/a).

oneOf.markdownDescription: Open the link in the current browsing context.
Open the link in a new tab, but users can configure browsers to open a new window instead.
Open the link in the parent browsing context of the current one. If no parent, behaves as `_self`.
Open the link in the topmost browsing context (the 'highest' context that’s an ancestor of the current one). If no ancestors, behaves as `_self`.

sku-selector.title: SKU Selector
sku-selector.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-store-components-skuselector

The SKU Selector is a product details page block responsible for displaying every SKU available for a given product.

`"vtex.store-components@3.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

sku-selector:props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

visibility.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Defines the scenarios in which the SKU selector should be displayed.

oneOf.markdownDescription: It will always be displayed even if the product has only one SKU option
The SKU Selector is only displayed when the product has more than one SKU option

visibleVariations.markdownDescription:
`array`

Specifies which product variations should be displayed in the product details page. Notice the following: if you declare a name that doesn't represent a real product variation or an empty array, no variations will be displayed.

hideImpossibleCombinations.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Whether a product variation that leads to an impossible product combination should be clickable (`true`) or not (`false`). Notice that in both scenarios the variation will be displayed. However, when the prop is set as `false`, the variation is faded displayed (with less opacity).

disableUnavailableSelectOptions.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Whether a product variation that leads to an impossible product combination should be displayed with the disabled attribute when `displayMode` is set to `select`. By default, all select options are without the disabled attribute set based on the type of variation

maxItems.markdownDescription:
`number`

Maximum number of variation items to be displayed in the SKU Selector before the See more button. The button will always be displayed 2 items before the number set in maxItems.

showValueForVariation.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Displays a value for the selected variation. This prop replaces the former `showValueNameForImageVariation` (deprecated).

oneOf.markdownDescription: No values are displayed when the variation is selected
Displays only the image value for the selected variation, if any
All variation values are displayed

variationsSpacing.markdownDescription:
`number`

Defines the `margin-bottom` size to be applied in the rendered product variations. Possible values are from `0` to `11` (the prop value is not in `px`, every value represents a tachyons class).

showVariationsErrorMessage.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Whether an error message should be displayed whenever the `BuyButton` is clicked on but no available variation was selected (`true`) or not (`false`).

showVariationsLabels.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Where variation names should be displayed.

oneOf.markdownDescription: Doesn't display the variation names
Shows the variation name as a header of the items
Displays the variation name before with each item's value
Behaves as `variation` and `itemValue` at the same time

displayMode.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Defines how the product variation names will be displayed (it doesn't apply to product variation images). Notice that this prop is responsive, so you can declare an object as its value specifying a value for each breakpoint (`desktop` and `mobile`).

oneOf.markdownDescription: Displays all variation names
Only displays the selected variation name
Displays all variation names in a slider when the number of available options in greater than the value defined in the `sliderDisplayThreshold` prop

sliderDisplayThreshold.markdownDescription:
`number`

Minimum number of product variation names that should be displayed using `slider` display mode. This prop only properly works when `displayMode` is set as `slider`.

sliderArrowSize.markdownDescription:
`number`

Controls the size (height and width) in pixels of the navigation arrows rendered when `displayMode` is set as `slider`.

sliderItemsPerPage.markdownDescription:
`object`

Controls how many slides should be shown on each type of device when `displayMode` is set as `slider`.

desktop.markdownDescription:
`number`

number of slides to be displayed on desktop devices when `displayMode` is set as `slider`.

tablet.markdownDescription:
`number`

number of slides to be displayed on tablet devices when `displayMode` is set as `slider`.

mobile.markdownDescription:
`number`

 number of slides to be displayed on phone devices when `displayMode` is set as `slider`.

thumbnailImage.markdownDescription:
`string`

First image to be displayed. This prop value must be the same text string defined in the desired product image's `imageLabel` field (from the Catalog module). If you use this prop and no image declaring the same text string in its `imageLabel` field is found, any product image will be randomly rendered instead.

imageHeight.markdownDescription:
`number | object`

Height (in `px`) of the product thumbnail image. You can declare an object as its value in case you want to define a height for each device (`desktop` and `mobile`).

imageWidth.markdownDescription:
`number | object`

Width (in `px`) of the product thumbnail image. You can declare an object as its value in case you want to define a width for each device (`desktop` and `mobile`).

initialSelection.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Controls the user initial selection for available variations when product page is fully loaded.

oneOf.markdownDescription: Selects the first available SKU's variation values
Selects the first available image variation
No variations will be selected when the page is loaded
Displays all variation names
Only displays the selected variation name
Displays all variation names in a slider when the number of available options in greater than the value defined in the `sliderDisplayThreshold` prop

notification.bar.title: Notification (Bar)
notification.bar.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-store-components-notification

`Notification` is a VTEX component allows you to display a text content in a bar style or inline. This Component can be imported and used by any VTEX app.

`"vtex.store-components@3.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

content.markdownDescription:
`string`

Text to be used in the bar.

notification.inline.title: Notification (Inline)
notification.inline.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-store-components-notification

`Notification` is a VTEX component allows you to display a text content in a bar style or inline. This Component can be imported and used by any VTEX app.

`"vtex.store-components@3.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

content.markdownDescription:
`string`

Text to be used in the bar.

product-brand.title: Product Brand
product-brand.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-store-components-productbrand

The `ProductBrand` is a VTEX block that displays either the name or the logo of a product's brand.

`"vtex.store-components@3.x"`

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

displayMode.markdownDescription:
`string`

You should choose between `logo` or `text`. This will define if the product brand will be displayed by name or logo.

fallbackToText.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

This prop should only be used when `displayMode` is set to `logo`. It defines what should be done when the Product Brand was set to display a brand logo but no image was registered in the VTEX admin's Catalog. This prop is set as `true` by default, allowing the logo to be replaced with the brand name in those scenarios. When set as `false`, the store will not show the brand name instead of the brand logo.

loadingPlaceholder.markdownDescription:
`string`

You should choose between `logo` or `text`. This will define if the loading placeholder should have the size of the logo or the text.

height.markdownDescription:
`number`

It sets the logo height. It should only be used when `displayMode` is set to `logo`.

excludeBrands.markdownDescription:
`array`

The brand names or brand IDs listed in the array will never be displayed by the Brand component. It is usually useful to hide default or test brand names/logos on the store front.

withLink.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Defines the scenarios in which the product brand should have a link that leads to its website.

oneOf.markdownDescription:
`array`

Never includes the link

`array`

Includes the link whenever the brand logo is displayed

`array`

Includes the link whenever the brand name is displayed

`array`

Includes the link whenever the brand logo or the brand name is displayed

brandName.markdownDescription:
`string`

The brand name. If no value is declared, the product context should provide the data.

brandId.markdownDescription:
`number`

The brand ID. If no value is declared, the product context should provide the data.

product-description.title: Product Description
product-description.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-store-components-productdescription

`ProductDescription` is a VTEX block that displays the description of a product. This Component can be imported and used by any VTEX App.

`"vtex.store-components@3.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

collapseContent.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

If `true`, whenever the product description is too big, it will collapse and show a *Show More* button. When `false`, it will never collapse and will always show the whole description.

title.markdownDescription:
`string`

Defines a custom title for the description section.

showTitle.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Define whether or not to show the title.

product-name.title: Product Name
product-name.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-store-components-productname

The `ProductName` is a block responsible for **displaying the product name** along other information such as **SKU** or **brand**.

`"vtex.store-components@3.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

displayMode.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Possible values: `linkToProductPage` (show the product link associated with its name) or `plainText` (to show only the product name).

oneOf.markdownDescription:
`array`

Show the product link associated with its name

`array`

Show only the product name

product-images.title: Product Images
product-images.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-store-components-productimages

`ProductImages` is a VTEX block responsible for rendering a product image or video.

`"vtex.store-components@3.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

aspectRatio.markdownDescription:
`string`

Sets the aspect ratio of the image, that is, whether the image should be square, portrait, landscape, etc. The value should follow the [common aspect ratio notation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aspect_ratio_(image)) i.e. two numbers separated by a colon such as `1:1` for square, `3:4` for upright portrait, or `1920:1080` for even large values.

contentOrder.markdownDescription:
`string`

Controls the order in which the images and videos are displayed.

displayThumbnailsArrows.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Displays navigation arrows on the thumbnails media (if there are enough thumbnails for them to scroll)

placeholder.markdownDescription:
`string`

Sets the URL for a placeholder image to be used in case there is no available image or video of the product.

hiddenImages.markdownDescription:
`string`

Hides images whose labels match the values listed in this prop. Intended to be used along with the `product-summary-sku-selector` block. You can have more information at the [SKU Selector](https://vtex.io/docs/components/all/vtex.store-components/sku-selector) documentation

maxHeight.markdownDescription:
`number`

Maximum height for individual product images (in pixels).

position.markdownDescription:
`number`

Set the position of the thumbnails (`left` or `right`). Only used when `thumbnailsOrientation` is `vertical`

showNavigationArrows.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Controls if the navigation arrows should appear`

showPaginationDots.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Controls if the pagination dots should appear`

thumbnailAspectRatio.markdownDescription:
`string`

Sets the aspect ratio of the thumbnail image; For more information about aspect ratio, check the `aspectRatio` prop

thumbnailMaxHeight.markdownDescription:
`number`

Maximum height for the thumbnail image (in pixels).

thumbnailsOrientation.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Choose the orientation of the thumbnails. Can be set to `vertical` or `horizontal`

zoomFactor.markdownDescription:
`number`

Sets how much the zoom increases the image size (e.g. `2` will make the zoomed-in image twice as large)

oneOf.markdownDescription: Zoom is disabled
Zoom will be triggered when the image is clicked on
Zoom will be triggered when the image is hovered on
Image is zoomed using a modal

ModalZoom.markdownDescription:
`block`

Opens a modal for product image zooming. This prop's value must match the name of the block responsible for triggering the modal containing the product image for zooming (e.g. `modal-layout` from (Modal layout)[https://vtex.io/docs/components/all/vtex.modal-layout/] app). Notice that the `ModalZoom` prop will work only if the `zoomMode` prop is set as `open-modal`. To learn more, check out the [Advanced Configuration](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-store-components-productimages#advanced-configuration).

displayMode.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Defines how the product media should be displayed

oneOf.markdownDescription: Displays the product images and videos in a carousel

Displays only the product images inline, with no extra markup. *Caution*: The `list` value does not display product videos and it is only compatible with the `maxHeight`, `hiddenImages`, `zoomFactor`, `aspectRatio`,`ModalZoomElement`, and `zoomMode` props.

share.title: Share
share.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-store-components-share

`Share` is a VTEX component that allows to share a product url via social medias. This component can be imported and used by any VTEX app.

`"vtex.store-components@3.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

size.markdownDescription:
`number`

The size of the share button in pixels

social.markdownDescription:
`object`

The possible social medias to be displayed

imageUrl.markdownDescription:
`string`

Image url to share in social medias

shipping-simulator.title: Shipping Simulator
shipping-simulator.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-store-components-shippingsimulator

The Shipping Simulator block **estimates the shipping fee** based on a zip code input.

`"vtex.store-components@3.x"`

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

skuId.markdownDescription:
`string`

ID of the current product SKU

pricingMode.markdownDescription:
`enum`

If the product has gifts or attachments, for example, you can choose whether the shipping information will be grouped (`grouped`) by shipping type or showing the shipping prices for each of the items individually (`individualItems`).

shouldUpdateOrderForm.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Whether interacting with the simulator should update the shopper's address in their orderForm

modal-trigger.title: Modal Layout (Trigger)
modal-trigger.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-modal-layout

The Modal Layout app provides blocks that can help you create modals in your store.

![Mandatory](https://img.shields.io/badge/-Mandatory-red.png) Defines how the Modal content will be triggered through its children blocks.

`"vtex.modal-layout@0.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

children.markdownDescription: Declare the blocks that must be wrapped inside the current one.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

trigger.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Whether the Modal content should be triggered by user click (`click`), when the page is fully loaded (`load`) or when the page is fully loaded but the modal will appears just once per session (`load-session`).

customPixelEventId.markdownDescription:
`string`

Store event ID responsible for triggering the `modal-trigger` block (hence triggering the opening of `modal-layout` blocks on the interface as well).

customPixelEventName.markdownDescription:
`string`

Store event name responsible for triggering the `modal-trigger` block (hence triggering the opening of `modal-layout` blocks on the interface as well). Some examples are: `addToCart` and 'removeFromCart` events. Notice that using this prop will make the associated `modal-layout` open in **every** event with the specified name if no `customPixelEventId` is specified.

modal-header.title: Modal Layout (Header)
modal-header.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-modal-layout

The Modal Layout app provides blocks that can help you create modals in your store.

Renders a close button and the blocks listed as its children, building a modal header. Notice: it does not automatically render a header for your modal. Instead, you should create the modal header as you desire using this block's children list.

`"vtex.modal-layout@0.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

children.markdownDescription: Declare the blocks that must be wrapped inside the current one.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

showCloseButton.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Whether the close icon button should be rendered in the modal header (`true`) or not (`false`).

iconCloseSize.markdownDescription:
`number`

Size (in pixels) of the close icon button in the modal header.

modal-layout.title: Modal Layout (Layout)
modal-layout.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-modal-layout

The Modal Layout app provides blocks that can help you create modals in your store.

![Mandatory](https://img.shields.io/badge/-Mandatory-red.png) Defines how the Modal content will be rendered through its children blocks. You can declare as its children the blocks `modal-header` and `modal-content` in order to create a modal with header and footer.

`"vtex.modal-layout@0.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

children.markdownDescription: Declare the blocks that must be wrapped inside the current one.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

scroll.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Defines how the modal should be scrolled by users.

oneOf.markdownDescription: Users can scroll the whole modal by normally scrolling the page
Users can scroll the modal *content* when hovering it

disableEscapeKeyDown.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Whether the modal should be closed when pressing the `Esc` key (`true`) or not (`false`).

fullScreen.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Whether the modal should fill the whole screen (`true`) or not (`false`). This prop is responsive i.e. it adapts itself to the device's breakpoints.

backdrop.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Whether the modal will have a clickable backdrop (`clickable`) or no backdrop at all (`none`). This prop is responsive i.e. it adapts itself to the device's breakpoints.

modal-actions.close.title: Modal Layout (Close Button)
modal-actions.close.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-modal-layout

The Modal Layout app provides blocks that can help you create modals in your store.

Button that closes the modal when clicked on. It is extremely useful in scenarios where your modal only has a form or a disclaimer box providing information for users.

`"vtex.modal-layout@0.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

label.markdownDescription:
`string`

Defines the text to be rendered in the close button. This prop default value depends on the store's default language which is set according to the website's [binding](https://help.vtex.com/tutorial/what-is-binding--4NcN3NJd0IeYccgWCI8O2W?locale=en). Default is: `Cancel`, `Cancelar`, or `Cancelar` for stores whose default language is, respectively, `English`, `Spanish` or `Portuguese`.

modal-actions.title: Modal Layout (Actions)
modal-actions.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-modal-layout

The Modal Layout app provides blocks that can help you create modals in your store.

Logical block only responsible for rendering its child blocks that, in turn, are responsible for rendering call-to-action buttons inside the modal, such as a confirmation button.

`"vtex.modal-layout@0.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

children.markdownDescription: Declare the blocks that must be wrapped inside the current one.

modal-content.title: Modal Layout (Content)
modal-content.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-modal-layout

The Modal Layout app provides blocks that can help you create modals in your store.

Defines how the Modal content will be rendered through its children blocks. Preferably, this block should be used along with the modal-header in order to create a modal with header and footer.

`"vtex.modal-layout@0.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

children.markdownDescription: Declare the blocks that must be wrapped inside the current one.

slider-layout.title: Slider Layout
slider-layout.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-modal-layout

Slider Layout is a flexible solution for building sliders of blocks within VTEX Store Framework, such as a carousel component.

![Mandatory](https://img.shields.io/badge/-Mandatory-red.png) Builds sliders of blocks for your store through its children list blocks.

`"vtex.slider-layout@0.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

children.markdownDescription: Declare the blocks that must be wrapped inside the current one.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

label.markdownDescription:
`string`

`aria-label` attribute value to be used by the `<Slider/>` component when rendered. The `aria-label` value should explicitly tell users what the HTML element being inspected is responsible for.

showNavigationArrows.markdownDescription:
`enum`

When navigation arrows should be rendered. Possible values are: `mobileOnly`, `desktopOnly`, `always`, or `never`.

showPaginationDots.markdownDescription:
`enum`

When pagination dots should be rendered. Possible values are: `mobileOnly`, `desktopOnly`, `always`, or `never`.

infinite.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Whether the slider should be infinite (`true`) or not (`false`). When this prop is set as `false`, the slider will have an explicit end for users.

usePagination.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Whether the slider should use slide pages (`true`) or not (`false`). When this prop is set as `false`, the slider will use smooth scrolling for slide navigation instead of arrows.

itemsPerPage.markdownDescription:
`object`

number of slider items to be shown on each type of device.

desktop.markdownDescription:
`number`

number of slides to be shown on desktop devices.

tablet.markdownDescription:
`number`

number of slides to be shown on desktop devices.

phone.markdownDescription:
`number`

number of slides to be shown on desktop devices.

navigationStep.markdownDescription:
`object`

number of slider items to be shown on each type of device.

slideTransition.markdownDescription:
`object`

Controls the transition animation between slides based on [CSS attributes](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/transition).

stopOnHover.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Whether the auto play should stop when users are hovering the slider (`true`) or not (`false`).

fullWidth.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Whether the slides should occupy the full page width, making the arrows appear on top of them (`true`) or not (`false`).

arrowSize.markdownDescription:
`object`

Slider arrows size (height and width) in pixels. This is a responsive prop, which means you can pass to it an object with different values for each breakpoint (`desktop`, `mobile`, `tablet`, and `phone`).

centerMode.markdownDescription:
`enum | object`

Defines the slider elements positioning on the screen. Notice: This is a responsive prop, which means you can pass to it an object with different values for each breakpoint (`desktop`, `mobile`, `tablet`, and `phone`).

oneOf.markdownDescription: Elements are centered, allowing users to see a peek of the previous and next slides
Align elements to the left side, allowing users to see a peek of the next slide, but not the previous one
Disables the feature, rendering elements on the whole screen without taking a peek in the previous and next slides

slider-layout-group:centerMode.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Defines the slider elements positioning on the screen. Notice: This is a responsive prop, which means you can pass to it an object with different values for each breakpoint (`desktop`, `mobile`, `tablet`, and `phone`).

oneOf.markdownDescription: Elements are centered, allowing users to see a peek of the previous and next slides
Align elements to the left side, allowing users to see a peek of the next slide, but not the previous one
Disables the feature, rendering elements on the whole screen without taking a peek in the previous and next slides

slider-layout-group.title: Slider Layout (Group)
slider-layout-group.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-modal-layout

Slider Layout is a flexible solution for building sliders of blocks within VTEX Store Framework, such as a carousel component.

Enables you to keep a group of slider-layout blocks in sync with each other.

![Warning](https://developers.vtex.com/img/emojis/warning.png|width=12px) **All `slider-layout` blocks declared in the `slider-layout-group` must receive the same configuration, meaning the same props and values.**

For more on this, check out the [Advanced configurations](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-slider-layout#advanced-configurations).

`"vtex.slider-layout@0.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

children.markdownDescription: Declare the blocks that must be wrapped inside the current one.

overlay-layout.title: Overlay Layout
overlay-layout.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-overlay-layout

The Overlay Layout app provides blocks that help you create a Dropdown, Select or a Tooltip component.

![Mandatory](https://img.shields.io/badge/-Mandatory-red.png) Declares a renderable children block responsible for building the overlay content.

`"vtex.slider-layout@0.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

children.markdownDescription: Declare the blocks that must be wrapped inside the current one.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

placement.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Defines the Overlay Layout content placement when it is triggered according to the Trigger component positioning. Possible values are: `bottom`, `left`, `right` or `top`. If there is no page space in the placement that you choose, it will fit in a fallback position.

scrollBehavior.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Defines the Overlay Layout content behavior when users try to scroll the page.

oneOf.markdownDescription: Users can't scroll
The block is closed when users start scrolling
Scroll does not affect the Overlay Layout content

backdrop.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Once the Overlay Layout content is rendered, it defines whether a backdrop overlay will be displayed (`visible`) or not (`none`).

oneOf.markdownDescription: The backdrop will close Overlay Layout content when clicked on.
The content will be closed only if any component from the page is clicked on.

showArrow.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Whether an arrow pointing to the overlay-trigger component should be displayed on UI (`true`) or not (`false`).

offsets.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Defines the `overlay-layout` component positioning when compared to the `overlay-trigger` (unit used is `px`).

skidding.markdownDescription:
`number`

Defines the `overlay-layout` component positioning side by side with the `overlay-trigger`.

distance.markdownDescription:
`number`

Defines the distance between the `overlay-layout` and the `overlay-trigger` components in the UI. A positive number places the `overlay-layout` component farther, while a negative number lets it overlap the `overlay-trigger`.

sticky-layout.title: Sticky Layout
sticky-layout.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-stack-layout

The Sticky Layout app provides layout structures to help building elements that should be fixed relative to the viewport in certain contexts.

The `sticky-layout` block is responsible for making its children stick to a certain position on the page when exiting the viewport while scrolling.

oneOf.markdownDescription: Component will stick to the top of screen
Component will stick to the bottom of screen

verticalSpacing.markdownDescription:

product-specification-text.title: Product Specifications (Text)
product-specification-text.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-product-specifications

The Product Specifications app provides blocks to render product specification data.

Mandatory children of `product-specification-group`, `product-specification` and `product-specification-values`. Depending on which block it is declared, the `product-specification-text` renders data regarding a specification group, a specification, or a specification value.

`"vtex.product-specifications@1.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

message.markdownDescription:
`string`

Defines the block's default text message to be rendered on the UI. You can also define which text message a block will render on the UI using the admin's Site Editor and the markers prop.

**Message variables available:**

`{groupName}`

`{specificationName}`

`{specificationValue}`

`{isFirstSpecificationValue}`

`{isLastSpecificationValue}`

markers.markdownDescription:
`string[]`

IDs of your choosing to identify the block's rendered text message and customize it using the admin's Site Editor. Learn how to use them accessing the documentation on [Using the Markers prop to customize a block's message](https://vtex.io/docs/recipes/style/using-the-markers-prop-to-customize-a-blocks-message). Notice the following: a block's message can also be customized in the Store Theme source code using the `message` prop.

product-quantity.title: Product Quantity
product-quantity.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-product-quantity#product-quantity-and-product-summary-quantity-props

The Product Quantity allows users to a add a chosen amount of the displayed product in their cart.

Displays a quantity selector on the product details page. This block must be declared in the theme's `store.product` page template.

`"vtex.product-quantity@1.x"`

product-summary-quantity.title: Product Quantity (Summary)
product-summary-quantity.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-product-quantity#product-quantity-and-product-summary-quantity-props

The Product Quantity allows users to a add a chosen amount of the displayed product in their cart.

Displays a quantity selector on [Product Summary](https://vtex.io/docs/components/all/vtex.product-summary/)'s blocks. This block must be declared as a children of the `product-summary.shelf` block.

`"vtex.product-quantity@1.x"`

product-quantity:props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

warningQuantityThreshold.markdownDescription:
`number`

Displays the quantity of remaining items in stock if the available quantity is less than or equal to the value given to this property. Default value: `0` (the quantity is not displayed)

showUnit.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Whether the unit of measurement should be displayed (`true`) or not (`false`).

size.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Preset size values for `font-size` and `padding`. You can check these value measures by accessing the [VTEX Styleguide](https://styleguide.vtex.com/#/Components/Forms/NumericStepper). Possible values are: `small`, `regular`, and `large`.

showLabel.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Whether a label should be displayed (`true`) or not (`false`).

selectorType.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Defines how the quantity selector should initially behave.

oneOf.markdownDescription: Displays an input field where the quantity can be directly defined, in addition to side buttons to increase or decrease the value
Shows a list of predefined-quantity options. In case the last quantity option is selected by users, the component is replaced with an input

showBultAsUnit.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Show the quantity of products as unit, this is useful in the case that the product have unitMultiplier. Possible values are `true` and `false`. On the `false` `showBultAsUnit`, the quantity will be affected with the unitMultiplier. On the `true` `showBultAsUnit`, the quantity will be not affected with the unitMultiplier.

vtex.product-highlights@2.x:product-high.title: Product Highlights
vtex.product-highlights@2.x:product-high.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-product-highlights

The Product Highlights app provides blocks to display highlight badges on products according to the collection or promotion they are linked to.

![Warning](https://developers.vtex.com/img/emojis/warning.png|width=12px) Parent block responsible for defining, according to its children blocks (`product-highlight-text` and `product-highlight-wrapper`) and props, how the Product Highlights component will be displayed.

Notice that **the Product Highlights' blocks need a Product context in order to work properly since they handle product data.** Therefore, when declaring them, be sure that they are in a theme template or block in which this context is available, such as the `store.product` and `product-summary.shelf`

`"vtex.product-highlights@2.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

children.markdownDescription: Declare the blocks that must be wrapped inside the current one.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.

type.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Desired type of product highlight to be displayed.

oneOf.markdownDescription: Highlights the product's collection therefore it must be used in conjunction with the [Collection Highlight](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/collection-highlight-control--1tGdb2ndjqy6yWsk2YwKMu?locale=en) feature.

`promotion` and `teaser` should be used when the product is configured with a [promotion with highlights](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/configuring-promotions-with-a-highlightflag--tutorials_2295?locale=en), but notice the following: `teaser` must only be used when the promotion presents restrictions. `promotion`, in turn, when it does not.

`promotion` and `teaser` should be used when the product is configured with a [promotion with highlights](https://help.vtex.com/en/tutorial/configuring-promotions-with-a-highlightflag--tutorials_2295?locale=en), but notice the following: `teaser` must only be used when the promotion presents restrictions. `promotion`, in turn, when it does not.

filter.markdownDescription:
`object`

Defines the highlights that should and should not be displayed by the block.

highlightNames.markdownDescription:
`string[]`

Array of highlight names to be hidden or shown (according to what is defined in the `type` property) by the `product-highlights` block.

type.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Whether the highlights names passed to the `highlightNames` prop should be displayed or hidden on the UI.

oneOf.markdownDescription: Hides highlights declared in the `highlightNames` prop
Only shows the highlights declared in the `highlightNames` prop

Props derived from Slider Layout block.

itemsPerPage.markdownDescription:

number of slider items to be shown on each type of device.

desktop.markdownDescription:

number of slides to be shown on desktop devices.

tablet.markdownDescription:

number of slides to be shown on desktop devices.

phone.markdownDescription:
`number`

number of slides to be shown on desktop devices.

infinite.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Whether the slider should be infinite (`true`) or not (`false`). When this prop is set as `false`, the slider will have an explicit end for users.

usePagination.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

showPaginationDots.markdownDescription:

showNavigationArrows.markdownDescription:

url.markdownDescription:

noFollow.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

openNewTab.markdownDescription:
`boolean`

Whether a new tab on browser will be opened (`true`) or not (`false`).

title.markdownDescription:

list-context.product-list.title: Product Summary (List Context)
list-context.product-list.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-product-summary

Product Summary is an app responsible for summarizing product information (such as name, price and image) in other store blocks, such as the Shelf and the Minicart.

![Mandatory](https://img.shields.io/badge/-Mandatory-red.png) Renders the list of products in the Product Summary component. It is responsible for fetching product data and providing it to the `product-summary.shelf` block. The last one, in turn, provides the product data to its children blocks.

In order to create a list of products, you need to use the `list-context.product-list` block and a `product-summary.shelf`.

`"vtex.product-summary@2.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

children.markdownDescription: Declare the blocks that must be wrapped inside the current one.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

category.markdownDescription:
`string`

Category ID of the listed items. For sub-categories, use "/" (e.g. "1/2/3")

specificationFilters.markdownDescription:
`object[]`

Specification Filters of the listed items.

orderBy.markdownDescription:
`string`

Ordination type of the items. Possible values: `''`

 `OrderByTopSaleDESC`

`OrderByReleaseDateDESC`

`OrderByBestDiscountDESC`

`OrderByPriceDESC`

`OrderByPriceASC`

`OrderByNameASC`

`OrderByNameDESC`

skusFilter.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Control SKUs returned for each product in the query. The less SKUs needed to be returned, the more performant your shelf query will be.

oneOf.markdownDescription: Most performant, ideal if you do not have a SKU selector in your shelf. Will return only the first available SKU for that product in your shelf query.
A bit better performance, will only return SKUs that are available, ideal if you have a SKU selector but still want a better performance.
Returns all SKUs related to that product, least performant option.

installmentCriteria.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Control what price to be shown when price has different installments options.

oneOf.markdownDescription: Will display the maximum installment option with no interest.
Will display the maximum installment option having interest or not.

listName.markdownDescription:
`string`

Name of the list property on Google Analytics events.

preferredSKU.markdownDescription:
`enum`

Controls which SKU will be selected in the summary

![Warning](https://developers.vtex.com/img/emojis/warning.png|width=12px) There's a way to select which SKU should take preference over this prop. You can create a Product (field) specification and per product assign the value of the desired SKU to be initially selected. Keep in mind that If the specification doesn't exist or if the value is empty, it will use the `preferredSKU` prop as fallback. You can read more about it, and how to implement it in [Recipes](https://vtex.io/docs/recipes/all)

oneOf.markdownDescription: Selects the first available SKU in stock it finds.
Selects the last available SKU in stock it finds.
Selects the cheapest SKU in stock it finds.
Selects the most expensive SKU in stock it finds.

product-summary.shelf.title: Product Summary (Shelf)
product-summary.shelf.markdownDescription:
https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-developer-docs/docs/vtex-product-summary

Product Summary is an app responsible for summarizing product information (such as name, price and image) in other store blocks, such as the Shelf and the Minicart.

![Mandatory](https://img.shields.io/badge/-Mandatory-red.png) Logical block responsible for providing the needed structure for the Product Summary component through its child blocks (listed below).

In order to create a list of products, you need to use the `list-context.product-list` block and a `product-summary.shelf`.

`"vtex.product-summary@2.x"`

title.markdownDescription: Define a custom name. It will be shown in site editor for faster identification.

children.markdownDescription: Declare the blocks that must be wrapped inside the current one.

props.markdownDescription: All available properties for this block.

blockClass.markdownDescription:
`string | string[]`

Block container class. This prop’s set value functions as a block identifier for CSS customizations.
